page.title: 17MILTON REGIS
page.content: Milton Regis,in its heyday,was more important than Sittingbourne.'Regis' means'of the King'and it was a royal manor visited by Kings of England.In 1984 a Mediaeval Fair recreating the past was so successful that it was repeated this year,1985.Milton is an old village and in the High Street some of the buildings such as the Court Hall still stand.The elderly have seen farmland disappear to be replaced by growing estate housing, both private and council.Sadly vandalism has grown with the increasing population and few wedding ceremonies are now performed locally for fear of cars being damaged and receptions being interupted,but the Church is active.Milton is home to many people who enjoy facilities such as tennis,cricket,football.The slopes on the rec.are good for sledging.
